reviewText: BACKGROUND: I am interested in learning Chinese brush painting and as a foundation for that I was looking for a video to provide training in basic standard (Kai Shu) Chinese calligraphy brush strokes, etc. so I purchased this video hoping for that. Unfortunately, this program is *not* a training program. It features a series of short "lessons" in which the host paints a few (1-3 characters) in a given style but does not teach foundational technique -- brush handling and brush strokes. The host is obviously a well-trained calligrapher and is more than capable of teaching the basics -- I wish she would do so in a future DVD. CONTENT: Introduction to Chinese Calligraphy (2DVDs) presented by host Ms. Li Zhengyan DVD1 Lesson 1: Jia gu wen (oracle bone inscription style) Lesson 2: Jin wen Lesson 3: Xiao shuan Lesson 4: Li shu DVD2 Lesson 5: Cao shu Lesson 6: Xing Shu Lesson 7: Kai shu (standard style) OTHER REFERENCES: There are several useful books on the topic (but they obviously lack video): (1) "Chinese Calligraphy Made Easy: A Structured Course in Creating Beautiful Brush Lettering" by Rebecca Yue (2) "Chinese Calligraphy: An Introduction to its Aesthetic and Technique" by Chiang Yee (3) "The Japanese Way of the Artist: Living the Japanese Arts & Ways, Brush Meditation, The Japanese Way of the Flower (Michi: Japanese Arts and Ways)" (3 books in 1) by H.E. Davey which presents (among other topics) a discussion on how calligraphy can be a form of moving meditation.
